result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland by the end of the next business day.  
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

miscConds.notes:
Undergo a Substance Abuse Assmt & comply with all treatment recommendations, to be completed within 90 days. 
Def to obtain a mental health assessment & follow all recommendation, to be completed within 120 days. 
Complete Moral Recognition Therapy IF directed by the DOC. 
Def is to complete individual counseling or group counseling that addresses issues surrounding domestic violence and prevention IF directed by the DOC. 
The Def is to obtain counseling/programming as directed by DOC.

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there. 
The Def is to take all medications as prescribed by treating physician and only in the manner & dosage as prescribed! 
The defendant is ordered to random testing.

Def to have NO ABUSIVE Contact w/ MRK
The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen w/in 7 days. 
The Def is granted jail credit of 2 days.
Upon successful completion of conditions of this sentence, this case record will be expunged per Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.015.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vernessa Snow Kingbird

defendant.name: Kingbird, Vernessa Snow
defendant.address: c/o Mavis Kingbird  75602 Moccasin Drive, Ashland, WI 54806

records.addlTxt: Accepting DEJ
Accepting DEJ Agreemt
DEJ Agreemt:  Ct 1

2:08 PM Defendant Vernessa Snow Kingbird in court.  Attorney Paul Arbuckle in court for Vernessa Snow Kingbird.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court provided with PLQ and Offer to Settle.  Parties agree.  State has complied with victim rights.  Victim makes a statement.  Back on the record at 2:22.  Some difficulty getting through the hearing today.  Back on the record at 2:26.  Atty and def in room with IPAD.  Def understands charges and penalties.  Atty, def PLEADS NO CONTEST, def agrees, admits that counts 1 and 2 are acts of domestic abuse.  File contains a PLQ and DEJ, def understands rights giving, and elements.  Def asks court to accept and make the DEJ the order of the court.  Def is waiving right to personal appearance.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts waiver to personal appearance and NO CONTEST pleas.  As a factual basis can court rely on information in the complaint, parties agree.  Court finds a factual basis exists and finds def GUILTY, and direct judgment to enter.  State comments on sentencing.  Atty comments on sentencing.  Court accepts and makes the DEJ the order of the court in count 1.  Counts 4 and 5 are DRI.  See attached for Counts 2 and 3.  On counts 2 and 3 def under the age of 25 if successfully completes sentences of 2 and 3 can be expunged.  With substance use disorder to be done w/in 90 days and MHA to be done w/in 120 days.
Probation review hearing scheduled for February 27, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Probation review hearing on February 27, 2023 at 09:00 am.

11:03 AM Defendant Vernessa Snow Kingbird in court.  Attorney Paul Arbuckle in court for Vernessa Snow Kingbird.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty parties have an agreement, have a DEJ, asking for another date so they are able to pay the fee to the DA office.  State no comment.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:30 PM - Prosecuting attorney Lynne K Van Hollen appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Vernessa Snow Kingbird in court.  Attorney Paul Arbuckle in court for Vernessa Snow Kingbird.  Agreemt.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

03:11 PM Defendant Vernessa Snow Kingbird in court with attorney Paul Arbuckle.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today. Atty comments- went over charges, pleads NG, noted  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Order on motion to seal/redact court record

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on June 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

09:05 AM Defendant Vernessa Snow Kingbird in court with attorney Paul Arbuckle.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State calls witness, Scoot Hultman, Sworn, Exam by the State. Ex's 1-6 are admitted, Witness identified the def, No cross by the Atty. The State has no other witness or evid. Atty has no witness or evid. State makes arguments. Atty makes arguments. Ct finds PC the def committed a fel in Ashland Co. the case is bound over for argnment. State is filing info now.  Atty does not object to motion to seal, Ct grants motion to seal, EX's will be confi. Arraignment scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
